original: DISTRIBUTION AND SERVICES AGREEMENT January 18, 2020 This is to confirm that, in consideration of the agreements hereinafter contained, the undersigned, the Integrity Short Term Government Fund, (the “Fund”), an open-end, diversified, management investment company organized as a series of The Integrity Funds, a Delaware statutory trust, has agreed that Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, (“Integrity”), shall be, for the period of this distribution agreement (the “Agreement”), the principal underwriter of shares issued by the Fund, including such classes of shares as may now or hereafter be authorized (the “Shares”).
ollama_generated:
DISTRIBUTION AND SERVICES AGREEMENT January 18, 2020

This memorandum serves to establish that in exchange for the mutual commitments outlined below, the party identified as Integrity Short Term Government Fund (hereafter referred to as "Fund"), a Delaware statutory trust organized as an open-end, diversified, management investment company, has consented to appoint Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC ("Integrity") as the primary distributor of shares issued by the Fund (the "Shares"). This designation shall be effective for the term of this distribution agreement (hereafter referred to as the "Agreement"), and shall encompass all classes of Shares that are currently authorized, as well as any additional classes that may be authorized in the future.

In this new formulation, the Fund is now agreeing to appoint Integrity as the primary distributor instead of Integrity being appointed by the Fund as the principal underwriter, thus shifting the responsibility from Integrity to the Fund.

original: Section 1.3 All activities by Integrity as underwriter of the Shares shall comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, including, without limitation, all rules and regulations made or adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) or by any securities association registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Fund’s Registration Statement.
ollama_generated: Section 1.3 In the performance of its duties as an underwriter for the Shares, Integrity shall strive to adhere to all relevant laws, rules, and regulations, including, but not limited to, those established by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") or any securities association registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as well as the Fund's Registration Statement. However, Integrity shall not be held liable for unintentional non-compliance with any specific rule or regulation, provided that it has acted in good faith and with due diligence to meet its obligations under this Agreement.

original: Section 1.5 Integrity acknowledges that, whenever in the judgment of the Fund’s officers such action is warranted for any reason, including, without limitation, market, economic, or political conditions, those officers may decline to accept any orders for, or make any sales of, the Shares until such time as those officers deem it advisable to accept such orders and to make such sales.
modified: Section 1.5. Seller's Obligation Recognizes that, at the discretion of the Fund's officers, particularly in instances of market, economic, or political instability, these officers may elect not to process any Shares purchase orders or execute sales until they deem it appropriate, with the understanding that no obligation to do so arises during such periods of refrainment.

original: The Fund shall also pay Integrity any distribution and/or service fees applicable to the Shares as authorized by the Shareholder Services Plan (the “Plan”) adopted by the Fund under Rule 12b-1 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 and set forth in the Fund’s Registration Statement. Such fees shall be payable in the manner and terms set forth in the Plan.
modified: The Shareholder, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Fund's governing documents, shall be responsible for reimbursing Integrity for any distribution and/or service fees applicable to the Shares, as defined by the Shareholder Services Plan (the "Plan") adopted by the Fund under Rule 12b-1 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 and detailed in the Fund's Registration Statement. Such reimbursements shall be made in accordance with the terms and conditions specified within the Plan.

original: The Fund agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold Integrity, its several officers and governors, and any person who controls Integrity within the meaning of Section 15 of the 1933 Act, free and harmless from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, and expenses (including the cost of investigating or defending such claims, demands, or liabilities and any counsel fees incurred in connection therewith) which Integrity, its officers and governors, or any such controlling person may incur under the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, or common law or otherwise, arising out of or based upon any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of a material fact contained in any registration statement, any prospectus, or any statement of additional information, or arising out of or based upon any omission or alleged omission to state a material fact required to be stated in any registration statement, any prospectus, or any statement of additional information, or necessary to make the statements in any of them not misleading; provided, however, that the Fund’s agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers or governors, and any such controlling person shall not be deemed to cover any claims, demands, liabilities, or expenses arising out of or based upon any statements or representations made by Integrity or its representatives or agents other than such statements and representations as are contained in any registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information and in such financial and other statements as are furnished to Integrity pursuant to paragraph 2.2 hereof; and further provided that the Fund’s agreement to indemnify Integrity and the Fund’s representations and warranties hereinbefore set forth in paragraph 3 shall not be deemed to cover any liability to the Fund or its shareholders to which Integrity would otherwise be subject by reason of willful misfeasance, bad faith, or gross negligence in the performance of its duties, or by reason of Integrity’s reckless disregard of its obligations and duties under this Agreement. The Fund’s agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers and governors, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon the Fund’s being notified of any action brought against Integrity, its officers or governors, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or by telegram addressed to the Fund at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to the Fund by the person against whom such action is brought, within ten days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served. The failure so to notify the Fund of any such action shall not relieve the Fund from any liability that the Fund may have to the person against whom such action is brought by reason of any such untrue statement or omission or alleged omission otherwise than on account of the Fund’s indemnity agreement contained in this paragraph 4.1. The Fund’s indemnification agreement contained in this paragraph 4.1 and the Fund’s representations and warranties in this Agreement shall remain operative and in full force and effect regardless of any investigation made by or on behalf of Integrity, its officers and governors, or any controlling person, and shall survive the delivery of any Shares. This agreement of indemnity will inure exclusively to Integrity’s benefit, to the benefit of its several officers and governors, and their respective estates, and to the benefit of the controlling persons and their successors. The Fund agrees to notify Integrity promptly of the commencement of any litigation or proceedings against the Fund or any of its officers or trustees in connection with the issuance and sale of any Shares.
ollama_generated:
The Investor acknowledges and assumes responsibility for, and agrees not to seek indemnification from, the Entity, its directors, officers, controlling persons (as defined under Section 15 of the 1933 Act), or any representatives acting on their behalf, for any and all claims, demands, liabilities, and expenses incurred as a result of any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of a material fact contained in any registration statement, prospectus, statement of additional information, financial statements, or other documents provided by the Investor to the Entity. This obligation shall not extend to claims arising from any misrepresentations or omissions made by the Entity, its directors, officers, controlling persons, or their representatives, except for those contained in the aforementioned documents.

However, the Entity agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Investor, its directors, officers, and controlling persons from and against any claims, demands, liabilities, and expenses arising out of or based upon any willful misfeasance, bad faith, gross negligence in the performance of their duties, reckless disregard of obligations and duties under this Agreement, or Integrity's violation of applicable laws, regulations, or common law.

The Entity's indemnification agreement shall only be triggered upon receipt of written notice from the Investor or its representatives, addressed to the Entity at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, within ten days after service of any summons or other first legal process. The Entity's failure to receive such notice shall not affect its obligation to indemnify.

This indemnification agreement and the Entity's representations and warranties will survive the delivery of any Shares and remain in full force and effect, regardless of any investigation conducted by or on behalf of the Investor, its directors, officers, or controlling persons. This agreement of indemnity shall exclusively benefit the Investor, its directors, officers, and controlling persons, their estates, and their successors. The Entity agrees to notify the Investor promptly of the commencement of any litigation or proceedings against the Entity or its directors or trustees in connection with the issuance and sale of any Shares.

original: SECTION 6. NOTICE TO INTEGRITY Section 6.1 The Fund agrees to advise Integrity immediately in writing:
modified:
SECTION 6. COMMUNICATION WITH INTEGRITY

Section 6.1 Integrity shall be notified by the Fund, in a timely and written manner, upon discovery of any circumstances that may impact the relationship between the parties:

In this revised clause, the obligation is weakened as Integrity will now be notified "upon discovery" instead of being immediately advised. This change allows for some flexibility in terms of response time by the Fund, but still ensures timely communication.

original: SECTION 8. MISCELLANEOUS Section 8.1 The Fund recognizes that governors, officers, and employees of Integrity may from time to time serve as directors, officers, and employees of corporations and business trusts (including other investment companies) and that Integrity or its affiliates may enter into distribution or other agreements with such other corporations and trusts.
ollama_generated: SECTION 8. MISCELLANEOUS Section 8.1 The Fund acknowledges the potential for governors, officers, and employees of Integrity to concurrently serve in similar roles for various corporations and business trusts (including other investment companies), and further recognizes that Integrity or its affiliates might engage in collaborative arrangements, such as distribution or other agreements, with these entities. The Fund hereby agrees to bear the potential conflicts of interest resulting from such affiliations, understanding that the actions and decisions made by these individuals may indirectly impact the Fund.

original: Source: INTEGRITY FUNDS, 485BPOS, 1/21/2020 Section 8.3 This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Kansas.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: INTEGRITY FUNDS, 485BPOS, 1/21/2020 Section 8.3 This Agreement may be interpreted under the governing law of any jurisdiction at the sole discretion of the parties involved, with the primary consideration being the laws of Kansas.

Changes: The revised clause allows for flexibility in interpreting the agreement under different jurisdictions, giving more power to the parties involved, rather than strictly adhering to the laws of Kansas as stated in the original clause.

original: Section 8.4 This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original; but such counterparts shall, together, constitute only one instrument.
ollama_generated: Section 8.4: Each individual counterpart of this Agreement, once executed, shall be considered a valid and binding part thereof. However, the collection of these separate counterparts will collectively form a single, indivisible document. This allows for flexibility in execution while maintaining the integrity of the overall agreement.
